header.title: shell_docs

erlref.modulesummary: Functions used to render EEP-48 style documentation for a shell.

description.p: This module can be used to render function and type documentation to be printed in a shell. This is the module that is used to render the docs accessed through the shell through c:h/1,2,3. Example:
description.code:
1> h(maps,new,0).
-spec new() -> Map when Map :: #{}.
Since: OTP 17.0
Returns a new empty map.
Example:
> maps:new(). #{}
description.p: This module formats and renders EEP-48 documentation of the format application/erlang+html. For more information about this format see Documentation Storage in Erl_Docgen's User's Guide. It can also render any other format of "text" type, although those will be rendered as is.

desc.p: The record holding EEP-48 documentation for a module. You can use code:get_doc/1 to fetch this information from a module.
The configuration of how the documentation should be rendered.

taglist.item: Configure the encoding that should be used by the renderer for graphical details such as bullet-points. By default shell_docs uses the value returned by io:getopts().

Configure whether ansi escape codes should be used to render graphical details such as bold and underscore. By default shell_docs will try to determine if the receiving shell supports ansi escape codes. It is possible to override the automated check by setting the kernel configuration parameter shell_docs_ansi to a boolean() value.
Configure how wide the target documentation should be rendered. By default shell_docs used the value returned by io:columns().

desc.p: The HTML tags allowed in application/erlang+html.
